alert.note: Alert for Orange (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:35PM EST until December 19 at 3:25AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Orange. In southern Vermont, Rutland and Windsor. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM EST, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, including along the Ottauquechee River. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodstock, Chester, White River Junction, Reading, Woodstock Village, Bridgewater, West Windsor, Plymouth, Hartland, Cavendish, Hartland Four Corners, Pomfret, Windsor, Barnard, Quechee, Ludlow Village, Baltimore, Perkinsville Village, Weathersfield and Ludlow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
